results.title: Sixty years later
results.brief_description: To mark the Australian visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during the silver jubilee of her reign, Australia’s Navy, Army and Air Force combined to present a massed parade of personnel and colours in front of Parliament House, Canberra on 8 March 1977.

results.title: Six minutes with nature
results.brief_description: The life cycle of a butterfly known as “The Wanderer” showing the egg, caterpillar, eating, chrysalis and final emergence of the butterfly. This film won a special award for the best nature film in the Commonwealth Jubilee Film Competition.

results.title: Six Australians. Episodes 4-6
results.creator_credit: John McGowan and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Winner of the Human Rights Commission Inaugural Media Award 1984. The series explores the life and times of six Aboriginal Australians: Sylvia Blanco, Maurice Rioli, Neenya Charles (Eps 1-3), Trevor Adamson, Freda Glynn, Cliff Coulthard (Eps 4-6)

results.title: Sitting pretty: how to paint a portrait
results.creator_credit: Randolph Coats and Bell and Howell
results.brief_description: A dynamic and colorful demonstration of painting a portrait by one of America’s most popular portrait artists, Randolph Coats. A model is posed in various different lightings, before the artist decides on the one which suits his purpose best; then the process of painting a portrait is followed step by step to its completion.

results.title: Sisters of Gion = Gion no shimai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Masaichi Nagata, Daiichi Eiga and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description: Mizoguchi’s sympathetic film of the plight of women in pre-War society centres on two geisha sisters; Umekichi (Isuzu Yamada), and Omacha (Yoko Umemura). The sisters differ not only in age, but in the attitudes to their profession and the clients they service. The younger sister, Omacha, is disillusioned about men and relationships and actively sets out to destroy a young clerk. The elder sister becomes romantically involved with one of her former clients, bankrupt merchant Omocha (Yoko Umemura), and finds temporary happiness. Ultimately, Mizoguchi suggests they are both victims to circumstance and the position of women in society. Gion refers to the Kyoto district where the sisters work. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Sister Forsythe's casebook
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: Outlines the work done by a school community nurse in early detection of potentially serious health problems in students. Shows diagnosis of petit mal, child abuse, depresion resulting from overweight, bed wetting, poor coordination. Notes how the school nurse works in conjunction with parents and techers.

results.title: Sisal
results.creator_credit: East African Railways and Harbours Film Unit and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the cultivation and treatment of sisal, a raw material for rope making, in Tanganyika. Shows the way in which the leaves are removed from the sisal plant and conveyed to the decorticator machine; also the drying, grading, brushing and baling of the fibre. Illustrates the uses of the fibre; traces the history of the industry in East Africa and mentions problems associated with growth, processing and marketing.

results.title: Sirene
results.brief_description: Animated satire on present-day commercial life. Depicts a mermaid in the harbour of a modern city who is charmed by a young man playing a flute and attempts to flee with him, but the machines which surround the harbour destroy her. Interesting use of sound (contrast between the harshness of mechanical sounds, and the beauty of flute music), and the animation has a surreal quality that is quite effective.
